item.title: How to install Proxmox on a 2019 Macbook Pro
item.description:
I recently replaced a 2019 Intel MacBook Pro with a M3 Macbook Air, so I decided to wipe the MBP and install proxmox on it.

It wasn’t as straightforward as installing on non-Apple hardware, so I’m documenting what I had to do here.

Note that this post only covers getting things working on a MacBook Pro - look at the many online tutorials for what you should do once your node is up and running.

item.title: Store NUT metrics in Prometheus so we can display them with Grafana
item.description: I ordered a second UPS because thanks to PeaNUT, I saw that my current UPS is only providing 20 minutes of uptime. Unfortunately, as of this post, PeaNUT will only read one UPS’ metrics from Network UPS Tools per PeaNUT instance, so I’m going to start scraping the metrics into Prometheus and displaying them with Grafana. Here’s how I did it.

item.title: Set up nginx-proxy-manager with LetsEncrypt SSL certificates
item.description:
In the next few posts, I’m going to document how to set up Home Assistant (HA) from scratch. We’re going to want to protect the admin UI interfaces for HA and its support services with SSL, and add authentication to services that don’t provide it themselves.

We’re going to do this with Nginx Proxy Manager because it has built in support for using LetsEncrypt to obtain free SSL certificates, supports adding authentication to services that don’t do it themselves, and is overall easy to use.

Before I start writing more Home Assitant articles, let’s set up a SSL proxy server to keep everything secure.
